metadata.title: CVE-2024-23833 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description: OpenRefine is a free, open source power tool for working with messy dataand improving it. A jdbc attack vulnerability exists inOpenRefine(version<=3.7.7) where an attacker may construct a JDBC querywhich may read files on the host filesystem. Due to the newer MySQL driverlibrary in the latest version of OpenRefine (8.0.30), there is noassociated deserialization utilization point, so original code executioncannot be achieved, but attackers can use this vulnerability to readsensitive files on the target server. This issue has been addressed inversion 3.7.8. Users are advised to upgrade. There are no known workaroundsfor this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: openrefine package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
